Yes, YogaGlo has classes that focus on using props like straps, blocks, and blankets to help deepen your practice and make it more accessible.

They offer classes specifically designed to teach you how to use props effectively, such as:

* "Yoga with Props" classes, which focus on using straps, blocks, and blankets to modify and enhance your practice.
* "Restorative Yoga" classes, which use props to support your body in relaxing postures, allowing for deep relaxation and rejuvenation.
* "Yin Yoga" classes, which often use props to help you target specific areas of the body and promote deep release and relaxation.

You can search for classes using keywords like "yoga with props," "restorative yoga," or "yin yoga" to find classes that incorporate props.

Using a yoga strap can be incredibly helpful for hamstring stretches, as it can help you deepen the stretch and maintain proper alignment. YogaGlo's classes can teach you how to use the strap effectively and safely to get the most out of your practice.

In addition to YogaGlo, you can also explore other online yoga resources and websites that offer classes and tutorials on using props. Some popular options include:

* Do You Yoga: Offers a range of classes that incorporate props, including restorative yoga and yin yoga.
* Yoga International: Features classes and articles on using props, including straps, blocks, and blankets.
* Gaia: Offers classes and workshops on using props, including restorative yoga and yin yoga.

Remember to always listen to your body and use props in a way that feels comfortable and safe for you. Happy practicing!
